text:
We are actively working on improving the developer workflow, and this issue is something we’re working to resolve.

Regarding serverless functions, that’s not actually true. Developer sandbox accounts do in-fact support serverless. The confusion lies in that we have a few different developer accounts at the moment. For App developers they have an app developer account, which can then create “Test accounts” those test accounts do not have CMS Hub.

Then there is the developer sandbox account for CMS developers. That account DOES have serverless functions. Used in tandem with the enviornment variables you definitely can stage the serverless function and even have it operate  differently than your production build.
Ah, ok. That is great news!
When working building a new site for clients… do you typically develop it in their account or locally and then move/deploy it?
typically in their account. moving things from portal to portal in HS is tricky, and there’s no “local setup” of a full site.
<@U7SL518D6> Thanks for the yarn idea. We usually use npm. Is there any particular reason you’ve found yarn works better.

I personally don’t have a strong opinion. The tooling in our case was decided on by members of other teams involved. The reasoning may have been team familiarity.

The best part about the CLi and local development, you can use the tools that make sense for your team.

I really like *hs create react-app* by <@U7UBMQMDK>. Thanks Kevin!

Only my client is stuck on Vue.js. So, I’m working on creating some tooling and workflows.

It’s mostly working, <http://clarkebishop-dev-8091897-8091897.hs-sites.com/hs-vue>

The problem is images. Does anyone have any tips for how to embed images. Do I need to use Webpack to encode the images or something?
gonna throw this in here as well for a little cross posting action! <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CF540P856/p1594849503128300>

Thanks Melinda! That’s what we were thinking. 
We’re coming from a WordPress background and wanted to verify :)
